member.summary: Gets the access code expected to be returned to the client application. Depending on the flow, it may be null.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.ApplyAuthorizationResponseContext.RedirectUri
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback URL the user agent will be redirected to, if applicable. Note: manually changing the value of this property is generally not recommended and extreme caution must be taken to ensure the user agent is not redirected to an untrusted address, which would result in an "open redirection" vulnerability.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.ApplyAuthorizationResponseContext.ResponseMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the response mode used to redirect the user agent, if applicable. Note: manually changing the value of this property is generally not recommended.

member.name: T:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions
member.summary: Exposes various settings needed to control the behavior of the OpenID Connect server.

member.name: M:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.Issuer
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional base address used to uniquely identify the authorization server. The URI must be absolute and may contain a path, but no query string or fragment part. Unless has been set to true, an HTTPS address must be provided.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.SigningCredentials
member.summary: Gets the list of credentials used to sign the JWT tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware. Both asymmetric and symmetric keys are supported, but only asymmetric keys can be used to sign identity tokens. Note that only asymmetric RSA keys can be exposed by the JWKS metadata endpoint.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AuthorizationEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path where client applications will redirect the user-agent in order to obtain user consent to issue a token. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/authorize").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.ConfigurationEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path where client applications will be able to retrieve the OpenID Connect configuration metadata. Must begin with a leading slash, (e.g "/.well-known/openid-configuration"). This setting can be set to to disable the configuration endpoint.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.CryptographyEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path where client applications will be able to retrieve the public cryptographic keys used to sign tokens. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/.well-known/jwks"). This setting can be set to to disable the cryptography endpoint.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.IntrospectionEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path client applications communicate with to introspect tokens. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/introspect").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.LogoutEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path client applications communicate with to log out. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/logout").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.RevocationEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path client applications communicate with to revoke tokens. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/revoke").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.TokenEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path client applications communicate with to retrieve an access token. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/token").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.UserinfoEndpointPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the request path client applications communicate with to retrieve user information. Must begin with a leading slash (e.g "/connect/userinfo").

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.Provider
member.summary: Gets or sets the that the invokes to enable developer control over the entire authentication/authorization process.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AuthorizationCodeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the ticket format used to serialize and encrypt the authorization codes issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AccessTokenFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the ticket format used to serialize and encrypt the access tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.RefreshTokenFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the ticket format used to serialize and encrypt the refresh tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AccessTokenHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the optional security token handler used to serialize and the access tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.IdentityTokenHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the security token handler used to serialize and the identity tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AuthorizationCodeLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the period of time the authorization codes remain valid after being issued.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AccessTokenLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the period of time access tokens remain valid after being issued. The default value is 1 hour. The client application is expected to refresh or acquire a new access token after the token has expired.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.IdentityTokenLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the period of time identity tokens remain valid after being issued. The default value is 20 minutes. The client application is expected to refresh or acquire a new identity token after the token has expired.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.RefreshTokenLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the period of time refresh tokens remain valid after being issued. The default value is 14 days. The client application is expected to start a whole new authentication flow after the refresh token has expired.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.UseSlidingExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean indicating whether new refresh tokens should be issued during a refresh token request. Set this property to true to issue a new refresh token, false to prevent the OpenID Connect server middleware from issuing new refresh tokens when receiving a grant_type=refresh_token request.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.ApplicationCanDisplayErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean indicating whether the web application is able to render error messages on the authorization and logout endpoints.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.SystemClock
member.summary: Gets or sets the system clock used by the OpenID Connect server middleware to determine the current time. If necessary, the default instance can be replaced by a mocked clock for unit testing purposes.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.AllowInsecureHttp
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean indicating whether incoming requests arriving on non-HTTPS endpoints should be rejected. By default, this property is set to false to help mitigate man-in-the-middle attacks.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.HtmlEncoder
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoder used to sanitize HTML responses. If no explicit instance is provided, a default instance is automatically retrieved through the dependency injection system.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.DataProtectionProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the data protection provider used to create the default data protectors used by .

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerOptions.Logger
member.summary: Gets or sets the logger used by . When unassigned, a default instance is created using the default logger factory.

member.name: T:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerProvider
member.summary: Defines a provider exposing events used by the OpenID Connect server to communicate with the web application while processing incoming requests. This class can be used as a virtual base class, but it also offers delegate properties that can be used to handle individual calls without having to explicitly declare a new subclassed type.

member.name: P:Owin.Security.OpenIdConnect.Server.OpenIdConnectServerProvider.OnMatchEndpoint
member.summary: Represents an event called for each HTTP request to determine if it should be handled by the OpenID Connect server middleware.

member.name: M:Owin.OpenIdConnectServerExtensions.AddEphemeralKey(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SigningCredentials})
member.summary: Adds a new ephemeral key used to sign the tokens issued by the OpenID Connect server: the key is discarded when the application shuts down and tokens signed using this key are automatically invalidated. This method should only be used during development. On production, using a X.509 certificate stored in the machine store is recommended.
member.param: The signing credentials.
member.returns: The signing credentials.
